Course Name: ACG 3074 - MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING FOR NON-BUSINESS MAJORS
Course Description: THE STUDY OF THE USES OF ACCOUNTING DATA INTERNALLY BY MANAGERS IN PLANNING AND CONTROLLING THE AFFAIRS OF ORGANIZATIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
OBJECTIVES:
STUDENTS WILL: 1)	UNDERSTAND HOW TO MEASURE BUSINESS ACTIVITIES, PROCESS THAT INFORMATION TO PREPARE FINANCIAL REPORTS, AND USE REPORTS TO MAKE BUSINESS DECISIONS. 2) READ AND INTERPRET FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR A PUBLICLY TRADED COMPANY. 3)	LEARN CORE MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES TO USE ACCOUNTING INFORMATION TO: A)	COLLECT COSTS AND DETERMINE PROFIT BY JOB B)	ANALYZE COST-VOLUME-PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS C)	DEVELOP A BUDGET TO COORDINATE ACTIVITIES D)	EVALUATE PERFORMANCE OF COMPANY MANAGEMENT E)	MAKE DECISIONS

LEARNING OUTCOMES:
AFTER COMPLETING THIS COURSE, YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO: 1.	PREPARE VARIOUS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS USED FOR REPORTING BUSINESS ACTIVITY AND FOR MAKING BUSINESS DECISIONS. 2. IDENTIFY AND CRITICALLY INTERPRET RELEVANT INFORMATION CONTAINED IN FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO MAKE INFORMED BUSINESS DECISIONS. 3.	ANALYZE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN BUSINESS REPORTS TO FORM OPINIONS AND MAKE CONCLUSIONS ABOUT A FIRM’S PROFITABILITY AND FINANCIAL STABILITY, INDEPENDENT OF ASSERTIONS MADE BY THE FIRM (I.E., DECLARATIONS BY MANAGEMENT AND BOARD MEMBERS). 4.	DEMONSTRATE MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES USED IN PLANNING AND DECISION MAKING, INCLUDING PREPARATION OF OPERATING PLANS, JOB COSTING, COST-VOLUME-PROFIT ANALYSIS, AND PERFORMANCE EVALUATION. 5.	CRITICALLY INTERPRET QUANTITATIVE EVIDENCE (SUCH AS GRAPHS, TABLES, CHARTS) IN ORDER TO IDENTIFY FALSE CLAIMS, INCORRECT USE OF EVIDENCE, OR CONTRADICTORY STATEMENTS (ALSO INCLUDED IN LO 2,3). 6.	REVISE SUBMITTED COURSEWORK BY INTEGRATING NEW SOURCES OF INFORMATION AND DETERMINING RELEVANCE OF EXISTING SOURCES. (ALSO INCLUDED IN LO 2,4) (PLEASE NOTE: TABLE 1. ATTACHED MAPS LEARNING OUTCOMES AND GENERAL EDUCATION COMPETENCIES TO ASSIGNMENTS)

MAJOR TOPICS:
FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING 1)	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS 2)	TRANSACTION ANALYSIS MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING 3)	COST BEHAVIOR AND ANALYSIS 4) FINANCIAL PLANNING AND COORDINATION 5)	PERFORMANCE EVALUATION 6)	DECISION MAKING
